column4: Record date: 2076-03-20
OFFICE NOTE
Lydia Levine
March 20, 2076
Ms. Levine is a 50-year-old, perimenopausal woman with non-
insulin dependent diabetes, hypercholesterolemia, and a history
of tobacco use, who underwent a recent cardiac catheterization
for a positive stress test.
At catheterization she had a
proximal 60% lesion in her RCA as well as a mid 60-70% RCA
lesion, obtuse marginal lesion of 60%, and an LAD mid lesion of
At the time it was decided to continue medical therapy on
Ms. Levine.
Since her cardiac catheterization approximately two
weeks ago, she has had no recurrent symptoms of chest pain.
She
continues on her medicines including Lopid 500 mg b.i.d.,
atenolol, aspirin, and sublingual nitroglycerin as needed, as
well as her oral hypoglycemic medicines.
Physical Examination:  She is an obese, white female in no acute
distress.
Her vital signs are stable.
Lungs are clear to
auscultation.
Cardiac exam reveals regular rate and rhythm,
normal S1 and S2; no murmurs, rubs or gallops.
She has no
peripheral edema.
Electrocardiogram shows a normal sinus rhythm at a rate of 70,
axis of about 46, and there are no acute ST-T changes noted.
Impression/Plan:  We will continue Ms. Levine on her current
cardiac regimen.
She has three-vessel coronary artery disease,
non-obstructive in nature.
As long as she remains asymptomatic
on her current medical regimen, we will continue to follow her.
She will return for a follow-up visit in approximately three
months.
Quinn Ivey, M.D.
/aponte
******** Not reviewed by Attending Physician ********
Record date: 2095-07-25
BMH Senior Health Return Visit

CC: 79 yo man hx depression, psychosis, insomnia, CAD, syncope, HTN, DMT2, carotid stenosis, PVD, recent right inguinal hernia repair c/b hydrocele, recent TURP for Bladder outlet obs presents for f/u of these and other chronic health problems
HPI: Briefly, patient to BMH with syncope in spring 2094.
Work up unremarkable including cerebrovascular imaging, cardiac cath, EP study, loop recorder.
Noted to have stable CAD and is on regimen for that including ACEI, BB, ASA, Statin.
In hospital, was noted that pt had had 40 lb weight loss over previous months.
Chronically elevated PSA noted.
Bone scan performed was unremarkable.
Right inguinal hernia noted, was repaired in October.
Pt noted to be depressed and psychotic, requiring inpt hospitalization on Psych floor.
Depn successfully treated and psychosis improved as well.
Has been followed by Dr. Nobles s/p d/c.
Presented to BMH in early Feb with abdominal pain, found to have bladder outlet obs from enlarged prostate leading to b/l hydronephrosis.
Repeatedly failed voiding trials s/p d/c despite maximal medical therapy.
Therefore, had an uncomplicated TURP.
Since TURP, pt had successful voiding trial.
Had been asked to continue his proscar and 2 flomax qd for another month, then stop proscar and continue with just one flomax qd after this period of time.
Still taking both, however, at this time.
Seen by cardiology .Felt stable from CV perspective.
Recommended lower ext ABIs/PVRs which pt declined at time.
Recommended restarting ASA s/p TURP.
Mood stable.
Has been only taking 3.75mg Zyprexa qd, not been taking 7.5mg as prescribed.
Has been having some weight loss per hx -- however, not so upon checking of weights in LMR.
Notes that he feels weaker than usual --"weak as a kitten."
Feels coincides with when he was hospitalized and meds then started.
Also notes watery eyes x few months.
WOnders whether this can be due to FLomax
PMH:
NIDDM.
Had had DM for >15 yrs
HTN x yrs
Hyperlipidemia
BPH
Diverticulosis ( noted on abd CT)
Basal cell carcinoma excisions on chest: followed by dermatologist
Carotids Stenosis
Claudication: walks a couple blocks before begins feeling cramps in
leg
Glaucoma
Inguinal Hernia: 9/93 pending surgery
?Ventral hernia
12: Depression
13: Psychosis
14: Insomnia
Medications
Aspirin (ACETYLSALICYLIC ACID) 325 MG (325MG TABLET take 1) PO QD , on hold for hematuria 3/02/2095
Brimonidine TARTRATE 1 DROP (0.2% DROPS ) OU QAM

Psyllium PACKET take 1 PO QD PRN
Remeron (MIRTAZAPINE) 15 MG (30MG TABLET take 0.5) PO QPM #90 Tablet(s)
Sennosides 1 TAB PO QD
Zocor (SIMVASTATIN) 80 MG (80MG TABLET take 1) PO QHS #90 Tablet(s)
Zyprexa (OLANZAPINE) 7.5 MG (5MG TABLET take 1.5) PO QD , Take 1 tab at bedtime #90 Tablet(s)
Allergies: NKDA
Health Maintenance:
Pneumovax: Has had in past
Influenza Vaccine: Gets flu vaccine each year - got this year through FHV
Colonoscopy: Done in 2094 showing only mild sigmoid tics
Pap test: n/a
Mammograms: n/a
Dex screening: never
Dental: Sees dentist Dr. Uecker every few years
Opthalmologic: Sees yearly through FHV
Functional Status:
ADLs: independent
IADLs: independent
Mobility: independent
HCP: Wife, Ernestine is primary proxy.
Alternative is daughter, Teresa Berry.
PE:
BP 112/58, P 60, RR 16, Temp 96.9 F, Ht 70 in, Wt 208 lb
BMI 29.9
Gen: NAD, Ox3, Alert, pleasant, normal affect, normal thought process and content, denies AH, VH, SI.
HEENT: PERRL, JVP 8cm
Chest: CTA b/l
Heart: RRR, normal s1 an s2
Abd: obese, distended, soft, no organomegaly
Ext: No edema b/l, distal legs hairless, 1+ DP pulses b/l, venous stasis changes, no ulcers
Skin: no rashes, no lesions
Neuro: CN 2-12 intact.
Gait WNL
Impression/Plan by issue:
Urinary retention: s/p successful TURP.
on Flomax/Proscar.
Likely does not need Proscar at this time per 3/27 urology note.
Will d/c.
need for FLomax s/p TURP given findings of weakness/runny eyes.
WIll set up with Dr. Eastman for f/u.
Depression: Appears fairly euthymic.
Getting f/u thru Dr. Nobles and FHV.
Continue Remeron.
PRN f/u with me if symptoms worsen -- have explained this to pt  who agrees with plan.
Psychosis: No evidence currenlty.
On Zyprexa, had been taking half of prescribed dose.
Dose not want further increase at this time.
Ok as w/o delusions/psychosis.
Weakness: Given low BP today, ?
relationship to low BP vs. polypharmacy.
TSH/CBC today.
D/c proscar.
Hope to D/c FLomax in near future.
Runny eyes: ?relation to FLomax.
Hope to be able to stop s/p urology visit.
No evidence bacterial conjunctivitis at this time.
Ophthalmology visit.
Syncope: No further episodes.
Getting f/u with cards for REVEAL interrogation.
Constipation: Resolved.
Now with daily BMs.
Have encouraged continued adherence to laxatives.
NTD
Hernia: Repaired.
No evidence of recurrence
CAD: No CP.
continue ASA, BB, ACEI.
CP free.
NTD for now
PVD: stable symptoms.
On full dose ASA.
Pt not wanting further studies to characterize degree of disease at this time.
Hyperlipidemia: Previous fasting lipid panel with LDL 51.
Old data -- will resend today.
Sending LFTs as well.
DM: Recent A1c of 6.7.
A1c today.
HTN: BP today WNL.
No changes in medication today.
Hx elevated PSA: Hx of PSA ~9.5.
Has gotten biopsy at FHV, WNL.
Bone scan WNL.
Now s/p TURP.
PSA today
Health maintenance: Pneumovax gotten thru FHV.
Has had colo.
RTC in 4 months, sooner PRN; will fax labs to Dr. Potts at Florence Heights Village, phone 668-508-1062; fasx 534-184-9285
Yusuf Lugo, MD, 42390

S:  ROS:  General:  no history of fatigue, weight change, loss of appetite, or weakness.
HEENT:  no history of head injury, glaucoma, tinnitus, vertigo, motion sickness, URI, hearing loss.
Cardiovascular: + hypertension - adequate control for patient on zestril, EKG - w/ Q wave in II, III, f and poor r wave progression w/ ?
inferior infarct, no chnage form 2065
no hypercholesterolemia, murmur, rheumatic fever, syncope, palpitations, edema, dyspnea.
Respiratory:  no history of asthma, COPD, TB, sleep apnea, SOB.
GI:  + history of GERD - stopped zantac about 6 months ago and had occ.
reflux, but know symptoms are more frequent w/ epigatsric burning, no hx of PUD, bleeding, change in bowel habits.
Hepatobiliary:  no history of jaudice, hepatits, colic.
GU:  no history of CRF, hematuria, obstruction, colic-stones, UTI.
Musculoskeletal:  + history of arthritis, has some joint pain and stiffnes, notices increase in pain in left shoulder w/ movement, no limitation of ROM.
Pt was using tylenol only for pain control, but that doesn't work with the shoulder pain.
Does ROM exercises, but not daily
Neuro:  no history of seizures, stroke, TIAs, migraine, radiculopathy.
Pt has + hx for diabetic neuropathy w/ parasthesias in extremities and now notes numbness in feet at noc interfering w/ sleep
Peripheral Vascular:  no history of claudication, DVT, varicosities, cramps, ulcers.
Endocrine:  + history of diabetes mellitus.
Pt currently on glucophage and glyburide.
Pt's glyburide was recently increased to 10mg  BID form 5 mg BID.
Pt has seen the nutritionsit recently as well and has f/u appt.
She denies eating sweets.
States she has toast and egg for brkfst, lunch and dinner eats chicken or fish w/ rice and plaintain and veggie, for snacks she has fruit: banana, grapefruit or apple; drinks are water or diet soda
Heme/Onc:  no history of bruising, bleeding, anemia, lymphadenopathy, chemotherapy or radiation therapy.
Psych:  no history of anxiety, panic attacks, depression, or psychosis.
Skin:  no history of rash, abnormal pigmentation, pruritis.

Record date: 2081-03-17

PICH CLINIC VISIT PT: Nora Greenwood Date of Visit: 3/17/81 ID/CC: 49F with type II DM, HTN, obesity, hidranitis suppurativa, panic attacks, and fibromyalgia presenting to PICH for f/u visit re: 1) DM, 2) hidrantis suppurative; 3) STD testing; 4) left shoulder pain and to sign up for narcotics log.
HPI: Interval hx to be reviewed by specific issue.
1) DM: Most recent HgbA1c 2/02/81: 7.4% (previously 6.9) and urine microalb/crt: 62.8.
AM FS: 109-160; 2 hour post prandial 114-115.
~ 2 episodes per month where she feels lightheaded, shaky and has to eat; has not checked FS at time of episodes; resolve with PO intake.
Describes frequently missing meals; not eating breakfast.
Continues to describe increased activity level.
2) Hidranitis suppurativa: Referred to general surgeon Dr. Iyer at last visit.
Nora saw Dr. Iyer on 3/02/81 who felt that given the broad extent of the left axillary involvement, she would require extensive debridement and excision, and likely flap rotation coverage.
He, therefore, referred her to plastic surgery.
Feels that she needs abx again bc of increasing drainage and erythema.
Cipro has been most helpful recently.
Previously cultured and negative for MRSA.
Today, denies fever, chills, ns, lightheadedness, increasing pain.
3) STD testing: Nora recently reported that her ex husband had told her that he had HCV while they were together but never told her.
11/80 HCV ab negative.
Completed further STD testing at last visit and HbsAg, HBsAb, TA-IGG, and HIV were negative.
Still have not been able to check GC and Chlamydia bc Nora feels she can not undergo pelvic exam given HS in groin area.
Denies any vaginal discharge.
Not currently sexually active.
4) Shoulder/Arm pain: See note from 2/02/81 for full hx details.
Had MRI scheduled for 2/9/81 but unable to go through 2/2 claustrophobia.
Rescheduled for open MRI on 2/28/81 which she was able to complete.
Have not yet received fax of results.
5) Pain management/ Narcotics log: Because of pain 2/2 severe HS and now L shoulder, Nora has been taking percocet 5/325 q 4 hours.
Reviewed policy for narcotics log.
Reviewed risks and benefits of narcotic use, including addiction.
Describes regular BM   s and no problems with constipation in spite of daily narcotics.
Problems Type 2 diabetes Hyperlipidemia h/o childhood asthma H/O pyelonephritis smoker Hypertension Obesity H/O hidradenitis suppuritiva FH Ovarian cancer Comments: mother, grandmother, and sister

Medications Miconazole CREAM 2% TOPICAL (MICONAZOLE NITRATE 2%) 1 APPLICATION (2% CREAM(GM) ) TOP TID Nystatin POWDER TOPICAL TOP BID x 21 days, please apply twice a day to affected areas Bactrim DS (TRIMETHOPRIM /SULFAMETHOXAZOLE DOUBLE STRENGTH) 1 TAB PO QD x 30 days Augmentin 875/125 (AMOXICILLIN/CLAV.ACID 875/125) 875 MG (875-125MG TABLET ) PO BID x 14 days Metformin 1000 MG (500MG TABLET take 2) PO BID x 30 days, start with 500mg 1 tab 2x per day; call to discuss increase in 1 wk
Hydrochlorothiazide 25 MG (25MG TABLET take 1) PO QD x 30 days Nizoral (KETOCONAZOLE) 2 CREAM (2% CREAM(GM) ) TOP BID , Apply to affected areas twice a day.
Zocor (SIMVASTATIN) 80 MG (80MG TABLET take 1) PO QHS x 30 days, if you develop muscle pain or weakness, stop the drug immediately and call your doctor.

Glucotrol XL (GLIPIZIDE XL) 2.5 MG (2.5MG TAB SR OSM take 1) PO QD Keflex (CEPHALEXIN) 500MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO QID x 14 days Levaquin (LEVOFLOXACIN) 500 MG (500MG TABLET take 1) PO QD x 14 days Cipro (CIPROFLOXACIN) 500 MG (500MG TABLET take 1) PO BID x 14 days Clindamycin 1% GEL TOPICAL TOP BID x 21 days, please apply to affected areas twice a day Phisohex (HEXACHLOROPHENE 3%) 5 ML TOP QD x 30 days Lisinopril 40 MG (40MG TABLET take 1) PO QD x 30 days Percocet (OXYCODONE+APAP) 5-325MG TABLET PO q4h PRN pain x 30 days, do not drive ot operate heavy machinery while on med as can make you drowsy
Ativan (LORAZEPAM) 0.5 MG (0.5MG TABLET take 1) PO BID PRN anxiety/panic , take one tablet twice daily as needed for panic attacks
Allergies Erythromycins - Hives, PE: Vital Signs BP 164/64, P 82, Wt 216 lb
General: obese F, appearing uncomfortable w movement of shoulder
HEENT: anicteric, mmm, no JVD
PULM: CTAB with good air movement
COR: rrr, nlS1S2, no m/r/g
ABD: obese, soft, NTND, +BS, no HSM appreciated
EXT: no LE edema, L shoulder w restricted ROM 2/2 pain; + increased erythema and mild drainage from L axilla
A/P: 49F with type II DM, HTN, obesity, hidranitis suppurativa, panic attacks, and fibromyalgia; a/p to be discussed by specific issue.
1) DM: Most recent HgbA1c slightly above goal of <7 (7.4) and increased from prior HgbA1c 6.9.
Suspect increased HgbA1c reflects recent cessation of metformin which Nora was not able to tolerate.
Per her report, fasting AM FS appears most elevated, although random BG checked at last was 186.
Asked Nora to keep a log of her FS, checking fasting, 2 hour post-prandials, and qhs FS on alternating days.
----increasing Glucotrol XL 2.5 mg qd to 5mg qd and suggested taking at night given elevated fasting FS, skipped breakfast but larger dinner, and daytime episodes of presumed hypoglycemia.

----once again reviewed the importance of regular, small meals given glucotrol; discussed considering switch to short-acting glucotrol Nora   s slightly irregular food intake to avoid hypoglycemic episodes.
Will consider switch at next visit and with review of FS log.

----Asked nora to check FS during episodes of shakiness; will need to monitor closely given recent start of BB and concern that it may mask sx   s. Discussed this w Nora and once again emphasized importance of regular meals on glucotrol.
----continue ASA 81mg qd, lisinopril 40mg qd
----2/81 urine microalb/crt: 62.8, above goal of <30 and likely due to persistently elevated BP.
Adding additional blood pressure agent today (toprol XL) and will re-check malb/crt once BP under better control.
----will perform DM foot exam at next visit.
Nora denies any numbness or tingling of extremities at this time.
----BP still not at DM goal of <130/80; adding Toprol Xl 25mg qd to HCTZ 25 qd and Lisinopril 40 qd
----11/80 (NON-FASTING): TCHOL: 189; HDL: 48, TRIG: 154, LDL: 110; on Simvastatin 80mg qhs.
LDL slightly above DM goal of <100, but Nora has since attempted to increase exercise and eat low fat, low cholesterol diet.
Rechecking lipid panel today.
----OPTHO: will need to confirm appt at f/u visit 2) Hidranitis suppurativa:
----will confirm referral to plastics and schedule if necessary
----prescribing course of cipro given e/o inflammation (less than previous flares) on exam today.
3) STD testing: Recent rpr, HIV, HBC, and HCV neg.
Still not able to test for GC/Chlamydia, but no sx   s at this time to suggest infection.
Will continue to offer, but again Nora declined given significant groin HS.
----recommended HBV vaccination and gave Nora green slip4) Left Shoulder/Arm pain: Suspect multifactorial 2/2 possible rotator cuff injury, biceps tendonitis, and adhesive capsilitis.
Offered steroid inject at last visit, but Nora declined and continues to decline.

----will call about MRI results and consider treatment pnd results5) Pain control/Narcotics log: Given increased use of short-acting percocet, started long-acting MS contin 15mg BID and encouraged use of percocet for break-through pain.
No trouble w constipation at this time, but warned Nora of increased risk given daily use of narcotics and encouraged hydration and increased fiber intake.
Also reviewed Narcotic log contract and conditions.
Nora is aware of conditions and rules as well as risks/benefits of chronic narcotic treatment.
She agreed to drug testing today as well as all conditions described in contract.

----checking urine drug test today (Nora affirmed use of valium and percocet at 6:00am) 6) HTN: Still above goal of <130/80 and with e/o microablumin on 2/81 urine test on HCTZ 25mg qd and lisinopril 40mg qd.
Will add toprol XL 25mg qd today.
Discussed possible side-effects including fatigue, mood changes, etc.
----scheduled f/u with NP in 10d to re-check BP and HR; consider increasing dose if still not at goal and HR tolerates.
Will also assess for development of any SE at that visit.
----TO DO: review sleep apnea ROS at next visit and will need to re-visit smoking cessation
7) Elevated AP: Suspect 2/2 fatty liver (elevated GGT confirming GI source and RUQ w e/o fatty liver) and asx at this time; continue RF modification (wt loss, strict lipid control).
Will re-check in 6 mos (~7-8/81).
Consider GI eval if significant elevation or symptoms.
8) Panic attacks: continue tx through psych (CBT and valium prn).
----confirm f/u appt w psych at next visit
9) +FH of ovarian cancer (mother, sister, maternal GM died of ovarian CA).
Has had multiple previously scheduled appts to see high risk clinic at MTCI.
Again offered to re-schedule for her, but Nora said that she had the number and was going to reschedule.
Asked her to call me with date to confirm.
10) TOBACCO USE: Nora reported quitting at last visit but today smelled of smoke.
Confirmed that she had restarted, ~ 4 cig/day.
Will need to discuss further at next visit and once again review crucial nature of smoking cessation for her.
11) HCM
----11/3/80 LIPID PANEL: (NON-FASTING): TCHOL: 189; HDL: 48, TRIG: 154, LDL: 110; rechecking today.
----PAP SMEAR: Pt overdue for pap; once again asked to defer given severe pain 2/2 HS; will continue to offer; discussed my concern regarding continual deferral of pap and the risks that this posses.
Nora states that she understands risks but feels that exam would be impossible given pain.
----MAMMOGRAM: Scheduled on several occasions, but never obtained bc of pain.
Nora still feels that examine would be impossible given HS.
Will continue to discuss and work to get treatment for her HS.
Expressed my concern regarding continual deferral of mammogram and risk for cancer.
Nora states that she understands risk but simply feels that it would be impossible given level of pain.
I offered to give her pain medications but she still does not feel that she could undergo this test yet.
Will continue to discuss with her.
----DV SCREEN: negative today; ex-husband again in prison.
Previous h/o abuse.
Will continue to screen.
----Ca and VIt D: gave her PICH pt education handout regarding daily requirements
----SEATBELTS: + use
----OP: review OP RF at next visit
TO DO:

----will need to review previous OPTHO findings; Nora mentioned that her opthomologist mentioned something I    should know   ; asked her to get phone number so I can call him to find out what she is referring to.
Pt to RTC in 1 mos or sooner if needed.
Will call Nora with results of MRI.
Pt was presented to and plan discussed with attg, Dr. Xian.
Record date: 2119-06-22

57 King Street, 5th floor
Newberry, OK  62981

Initial Medical Consultation Follow-up
Referred by: Dr. Juan Yun, psychopharmacologist, (PCP is Xavier Hobbs, MC) for comprehensive evaluation of obesity and consideration of treatment options.
Patient is being evaluated concurrently by a nutritionist and a psychologist.
CC/ HPI:  Patient is a 69 year old male, with
Weight:   227 (  231 )   lbs   Height:    68   Inches   BMI: about  35
and with obesity-related complications as listed below.
Main concerns about weight include: "I am overeating and can't stop".

Pt says he can't stop eating after 3-4 pm, gets enraged, aggressive, anxious, restless, (was given barbiturate and Ativan prn for this, and has improved somewhat ~40%) eats 1/2 gallon of ice cream per day, eats as aggressively as he feels, ongoing for 1.5 yrs.
Afraid he will do something aggressive, and uses entering a "food-coma" to help restrain himself.
Has bipolar, is in "mixed state" now, with characteristics of both depr and mania.
Has neurendoc MD, thinking his pattern related to "peak endocrine secretions".
Had binge drinking episodes till 2 yrs ago.
Drank for 2 days when switching into mania.
Learned to use substitution.
Learned to recognize mania coming on, prodrome, less need for sleep, euphoric speech, spending money.
Wife helped identify this.
Substituted going boating, listening to music, walking, talking to friends.
Wonders if substitution method can work for eating.
A potential method is to use 8 oz water or dietetic candy which have worked to satisfy his hunger.
Learned aggression is PTSD.
Rel to betrayal by mother at age 13.
Trapped, helpless, boxed in.
Medical ailments make him feel the same way.
Has has had talking therapy for ETOH, never for PTSD.
Thinks he may need therapy with wt loss program.
New hx:
Started Tramadol, thinks it's helping curb his hunger.
Will have ablation procedure for pain.
WEIGHT HISTORY:
Onset of obesity/overweight:  Birthwt 10'3.
Heavy till 17.
Highest weight:  220->255 (2103 dx'd with CNS lupus and given prednisone)
Course, triggers and exacerbators of weight gain:  Genetics.
Lost wt in military, wrestled at 177#, this wt till 25yo.
Wt gain onset w/ marriage, pt cooked, both ate.
Lots of sports and activity over the years.
Less time for phys activity as got busier by his early 50s.
Gained 35# on Prednisone x 4 yrs.
Gained 20# over last 1.5 yrs w/ psych-induced eating as above.
Family weight hx: F was built like pt, M 98# and could "outeat any man and never gained wt".
Eating habits: Bingeing?

Admission Note
HPI: 73 year old woman with hypertension, DM, peripheral vascular disease presents with dyspnea on exertion for 2 days.
Th patient was well and normally active with walking and usual activities without DOE until 2 days ago.
Last routine visit was in 9/91 w/ her PCP and was fine.
2 days ago noted DOE when going to store.
This persisted w/ activity only.
The patient was fine at rest and was able to sleep without difficulty.
There were no recent changes in her meds.
She had no other symptoms including CP, dizziness, URI symptoms, fever, chills, GI symptoms.
No PND, orthopnea.
She previously had a cardiac evaluation during a similar presentation in 2085.
She had a low level stress test and echocardiogram.
No ischemia was demonstrated at a very minimal exertion.
The echo showed LVH and an EF of 61%.
Because of an impending snow storm, she decided to come to the hospital for evaluation.
In the ED her BP was elevated and her 02 sat was only 78% on RA.
PMH:
Diabetes mellitus: on medical regimen, HgA1c 7.3 (9/91).
Hypertension: Blood pressure is 140/72.
Echocardiogram 12/85 - EF 61%, LVH.
ETT 12/85 - 4 METS, no wall motion abnormalities.
Hypercholesterolemia: on Lipitor 10, LDL 78 (4/91).
Peripheral vascular disease: arterial studies 10/90 - left SFA occlusion, and bilateral distal popliteal/ tibial
vessel disease.
She is well collateralized across the ankles at rest and poorly collateralized across the ankles post exercise.
Perfusion is adequate to the TM level, and poor to the digital level, bilaterally
Anemia: normocytic normochromic anemia with a normal SPEP and UPEP and iron studies.
Baseline hematocrit of low 30's.
Obesity.
Osteopenia with a history of right radial fracture.
MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION:
Tenormin 150mg po bid

hydrochlorothiazide 50mg po qd 1 tab po qd

Glucophage 1000 mg po bid take with meals

buffered aspirin 325mg po qd
vitamin d2 800 iu po qd
ALLERGIES: No known drug allergy.
SOCIAL HISTORY: Lives in Glencoe.
Has one son.
Originally from Clearlake.
Previously worked as a engineer at IBM research, retried a few yrs ago.
Exercises twice a wk for 1/2 hour, aerobic exercises and treadmill at the gym.
FAMILY HISTORY: Father has DM.
One sister diabetes father - diabetes.
Sister - diabetes..
REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Negative in detail except as otherwise noted.
PE:
GEN: WD, BF in NAD.
VS: BP 115/53, HR 55 reg, temp 97.7, 02 sat 97% 2L, RR18
HEENT: anicteric, oropharynx neg.
NECK: supple, no JVD.
CHEST: fine crackles 1/3 bilaterally, no dullness to percussion.
COR: reg, s1, s2 normal w/o s3, s4, m.

CXR (AP): No radiographic evidence of an acute cardiopulmonary process.
CT chest/abd/pelvis: 1.
No evidence for pulmonary embolus to the level of the segmental pulmonary arteries.
However, evaluation of the pulmonary vasculature is suboptimal due to respiratory motion.
No evidence for deep venous thrombosis.
Small right pleural effusion.
Intravenous contrast noted within the hepatic veins which could be secondary to CHF.
EKG: NSR, LVH, 1st degree AVB, nonspecific ST, TW changes.
ASSESSMENT AND PLAN: 73 year old woman with hypertension, diabetes, hyperlipidemia who presents with exertional dyspnea.
The patient's history, exam and CXR are not consistent with CHF.
The CT scan r/o PE and may be consistent w/ failure, but not clear.
More likely would be ischemia and is ruling out for an MI.
Clearly needs cardiac reassessment with echo and ETT.
Last ETT in 2085 but was normal at a very low level of exertion.
Finally, could this be a primary pulmonary process?
If her 02 sat of 78% in the ED is true, this should be pursued if cardiac evaluation is negative.
Specifically could she have an interstitial pulmonary process corresponding to imaging and exam w/ fine crackles.
Arguing against this is the acuteness of her symptoms.
Continue current regimen w/ holding Avandia and metformin.
